translated: but the smell of poison was there;
The gumbi deer, while seeking food,
dropped the poison in the forest.
and they came to death by it.
they were happy among the sick,
they were at peace while burning.
the poison of sensual pleasures is concealed;
This is a bait, a bond,
the abode of the demon of death.
attachment in the world, cross over the flood.”
The Gumbiya Jātaka is the sixth.
